required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Enteral Formula Tolerance in Pediatric Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Enteral Formula Tolerance in Pediatric Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this prospective study seeks to assess ability to achieve enteral feeding goals with standard polymeric enteral formula in a stable, pediatric tube-fed population.

detailed_description.textblock: In this prospective study, a population of stable, tube-fed children will consume a standard polymetric tube feeding formula to assess ability to achieve enteral feeding goals and tolerance outcomes.

primary_outcome.measure: Daily percentage of caloric nutritional goal met

secondary_outcome.measure: Daily percentage of protein goal met
Daily assessment of gastrointestinal tolerance - stool consistency
secondary_outcome.description: Daily assessment of stool consistency (liquid, formed, soft)

secondary_outcome.measure: Daily assessment of gastrointestinal tolerance- Stool frequency
secondary_outcome.description: Daily assessment of number of stool

secondary_outcome.measure: Daily assessment of gastrointestinal tolerance- Vomit
secondary_outcome.description: Daily assessment of frequency of vomit

secondary_outcome.measure: Daily assessment of gastrointestinal tolerance - Flatulence
secondary_outcome.description: Daily assessment of presence of flatulence

secondary_outcome.measure: Daily assessment of gastrointestinal tolerance - Abdominal pain
Frequency and nature of adverse events

arm_group.description: Enteral fed children, ages 1-13, with establish enteral feeding access

intervention.description: pediatric subjects will be fed a standard pediatric enteral formula tube feeding

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 1 - 13 years of age
- Currently tolerating enteral feeding
- Has enteral access
- Requires enteral tube feeding to provide 90% or more of their nutritional needs (without the use of modular(s)) for at least 9 days
- Having obtained his/her and/or his/her legal representative's informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Condition which contraindicates enteral feeding (i.e. intestinal obstruction)
- Lack of enteral access
- Any condition that would contraindicate use of the study product (i.e. need for severe fluid restriction, cow's milk protein allergy, other)
- Judged to be at risk for poor compliance to the study protocol
- Lack of informed consent
- Currently participating in another conflicting clinical trial

overall_official.affiliation: Children's Center for GI and Nutrition

facility.name: Children's Center for GI and Nutrition
